column4: i only recently upgraded to fiesty. previously, i had two ubuntu boxes (one dapper, one edgy) using samba to share files
i since upgraded the edgy box and now samba only works one way
the feisty box can read the dapper box but not the other way around
error messages are something awesome
smbclient -L <ip of other machine>
one thing I notice from that is the workgroups are different
that usually does it the way you use ti
edit /etc/samba/smb.conf and restart samba
connection by IP of course still works
i changed both smb.confs to workgroup but one is still reporting HOME when doing smbclient -L
I said "and restart samba"
yes restarted samba on both
how exactly?
/etc/init.d/samba restart
it's weird it's still reporting home instead of workgroup.  /etc/init.d/samba restart should be sufficient, correct?
did you do it as root?
then it does
/etc/passwd
plz look at http://www.pastebin.ca/592433.  Can't figure out where the HOME valube is being set.
in /etc/samba/smb.conf
I don't think so, I don't have 'HOME' in either smb.conf yet smbclient lists one as HOME
on all machines running samba
sudo grep -i workgroup /etc/samba/smb.conf
both boxes report workgroup = WORKGROUP but I know I have that in both already
